title: Trust & Safety Regulatory Counsel
content:
Trust & Safety and Regulatory Counsel
üöÄ Whatnot
Whatnot is a livestream shopping platform and marketplace backed by Andreessen Horowitz, Y Combinator, and CapitalG. We‚Äôre building the future of ecommerce, bringing together community, shopping and entertainment. We are committed to our values, whether working remotely or from one of our offices. We are building a team that has experience from top tech, retail and payments platforms in the world.
We‚Äôre innovating in the fast-paced world of live auctions in categories including sports, fashion, video games, and streetwear. The platform couples rigorous seller vetting with a focus on community to create a welcoming space for buyers and sellers to share their passions with others.
And, we‚Äôre growing. Whatnot has been the fastest growing marketplace in the US over the past two years and we‚Äôre hiring forward-thinking problem solvers across all functional areas.
üìà Opportunity Size
Retail disruption is one of the largest opportunities in the startup space today. Livestream shopping is taking off around the world ‚Äì a $300B GMV market in China that‚Äôs grown 100% YoY. Whatnot is bringing it to the world through a community-first approach, starting in the U.S. where retail is a $5T market opportunity!
üíª Role
 
We are looking for a self-motivated, organized and creative lawyer to serve as Whatnot‚Äôs first Trust & Safety and Regulatory Counsel. As a member of Whatnot‚Äôs legal team, this person will provide day to day counseling on a broad range of issues. 
What you‚Äôll do:

Advise operations teams on user-generated content issues, content moderation and marketplace regulations, law enforcement response and trust/safety matters.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement and maintain scalable processes for user verification, content moderation, data reporting, data subject access responses and others as required by law.
Assist the Trust & Safety, Policy and Support teams with daily responses to legal requests to ensure proper implementation of our policies and identify edge cases that need closer consideration.
Support engagement with regulators and legislators on safety issues
Work closely with internal business partners to provide strategic and proactive legal advice on arbitration, litigation and regulatory matters, including but not limited to understanding, interpreting, and applying current law and regulations to Whatnot‚Äôs current and prospective products and services.
Keep up-to-date on new legislation and regulations, including DSA, Inform Act and DAC7 to ensure the company maintains the highest compliance standards. This includes working with the product team to ensure that legal interpretations are aligned.
Investigate fraud concerns on the Whatnot platform and communicate legal demands as needed.   
Serve as point of contact on all Legal Data Requests and work with cross-functional teams to address requested information.
Litigate issues related to online safety

üëã About You
Curious about who thrives at Whatnot? We‚Äôve found that low ego, a growth mindset, and leaning into action and high impact goes a long way here.
You should have:

J.D. and license to practice law in at least one state.
6+ years of legal experience, including government, in-house and/or law firm experience advising technology companies
Litigation experience
Demonstrated work experience in the area of trust & safety and regulatory affairs.
Strong knowledge of regulatory requirements such as Inform Act, DSA and DAC7.
Experience reviewing processes and process documentation to ensure compliance with applicable regulations.
Ability to operate autonomously while being a team player who brings a positive attitude to the workplace and is willing to jump on any project, big or small.

üôè Nice to Have

Experience in a highly regulated industry
Experience supporting policy and governance teams within an e-commerce, marketplace, or retail organization
Experience taking on projects involving different subject matters, and working with cross-functional organizations to drive alignment
Experience supporting a global team at an internet services and technology company
Experience working on multiple projects in a fast-paced environment, delivering practical advice under pressure and operating within ambiguity

üí∞Compensation
For US-based applicants: $225,000 - $255,000/year + benefits + stock options
The salary range may be inclusive of several levels that would be applicable to the position. Final salary will be based on a number of factors including, level, relevant prior experience, skills and expertise. This range is only inclusive of base salary, not benefits (more details below) or equity in the form of stock options.

Competitive base salary and stock options
Unlimited Vacation Policy and Company-wide Holidays (including a spring and winter break)

Dental and Vision sponsored 100% by Whatnot for employees and dependents
